page.title: 13FARMING IN BRORA 1
page.content: A VAST AMOUNT OF BRORA IS USED BY FARMERS. MOST FARMS ARE SMALL AND A GOOD NUMBER ARE ON THE HILLS. SOME ARE CROP FARMS, AND SOME ARE LIVESTOCK FARMS . IN BRORA THERE ARE ONLY TWO BIG FARMS. THE REST ARE CROFTS.SOME PEOPLE OWN POULTRY FARMS. IT IS MAINLY COWS AND SHEEP THAT ARE ON THE LAND.HORSES GRAZE ON FARMS BUT DO NOT GET USED FOR FARM WORK AS MACHINERY TOOK CARE OF THAT. SHEPHERDS OCCASIONALLY KEEP GOATS. THEY USE THE GOATS MILK FOR LAMBS WHOSE MOTHERS HAVE DIED. HAY , BARLEY , OATS AND VEGETABLES ARE ONLY A FEW CROPS . CORN IS THE NAME FOR ALL CROPS LIKE WHEAT , OATS , BARLEY ect. HAY IS CUT IN JULY AND TAKEN INSIDE IN AUGUST. CORN CROPS ARE NOT HARVESTED UNTILL AUTUMN. HAY IS FED TO ANIMALS DURING THE WINTER.
